alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alachua; Gilchrist; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 2:22PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Gilchrist and western Alachua Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Archer, or 10 miles northeast of Bronson, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Alachua, High Springs, Archer, University Of Florida and Newberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
